means: 压碎，压坏( crush的现在分词)

sentence.Network_en: His loss would be a crushing blow to Liverpool's title hopes.
sentence.Network_cn: 他的缺阵将是对利物浦队夺冠希望的致命打击。

sentence.Network_en: a crushing defeat in the election
The attack on Pearl Harbor was a crushing calamity.
sentence.Network_cn: 偷袭珍珠港(对美军来说)是一场毁灭性的灾难.

entry.tran: 惨重的;毁灭性的;严重的
entry.def: A crushing defeat, burden, or disappointment is a very great or severe one.

example.ex: ...since their crushing defeat in the local elections.
example.tran: 自从他们在地方选举中惨败后

means.word_mean: 1. forceful prevention; putting down by power or authority;
1. physically or spiritually devastating; often used in combination;
